abstract: Gun owners in Michigan are divided over bill introduced by Republicans in State Senate that would allow people with proper permits to carry concealed weapons at schools, but would ban open carry; some see  open-carry practices as intimidating and disruptive, while others say concealed-carry can be far more dangerous choice.
lead_paragraph: A dispute in a Michigan district is part of a larger debate over state legislation that is pitting open-carry groups — and gun control activists — against those who favor concealing guns at times.

headline.main: Rift Emerges Among Gun Owners Over Concealing Weapons in Schools
headline.print_headline: A Dispute Over Way To Take Guns Into School

snippet: A dispute in a Michigan district is part of a larger debate over state legislation that is pitting open-carry groups — and gun control activists — against those who favor concealing guns at times.
